template.name: Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP
template.description:
The template to monitor SAN NetApp FAS3220 cluster by Zabbix SNMP agent.
MIBs used: NETAPP-MIB
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/416694-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-netapp-fas3220
Template tooling version used: 0.38

item.name: NetApp FAS3220: Failed disks count
item.description: The number of disks that are currently broken.

item.name: NetApp FAS3220: Failed disks message
item.description: If diskFailedCount is non-zero, this is a string describing the failed disk or disks. Each failed disk is described.

item.name: NetApp FAS3220: Product firmware version
item.description: Version string for the firmware running on this platform.

item.name: NetApp FAS3220: Product version
item.description: Version string for the software running on this platform.

discovery_rule.name: Cluster metrics discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of Cluster metrics per node

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Failed FAN count
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of chassis fans that are not operating within the recommended RPM range.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Failed FAN message
item_prototype.description: Text message describing current condition of chassis fans. This is useful only if envFailedFanCount is not zero.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Degraded power supplies count
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of power supplies that are in degraded mode.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Degraded power supplies message
item_prototype.description: Text message describing the state of any power supplies that are currently degraded. This is useful only if envFailedPowerSupplyCount is not zero.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Over-temperature
item_prototype.description: An indication of whether the hardware is currently operating outside of its recommended temperature range. The hardware will shutdown if the temperature exceeds critical thresholds.

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Temperature is over than recommended
trigger_prototype.description: The hardware will shutdown if the temperature exceeds critical thresholds.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Health
item_prototype.description: Whether or not the node can communicate with the cluster.

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Node can not communicate with the cluster

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Location
item_prototype.description: Node Location. Same as sysLocation for a specific node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Model
item_prototype.description: Node Model. Same as productModel for a specific node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: NVRAM battery status
item_prototype.description: An indication of the current status of the NVRAM battery or batteries. Batteries which are fully or partially discharged may not fully protect the system during a crash. The end-of-life status values are based on the manufacturer's recommended life for the batteries. Possible values: ok(1), partiallyDischarged(2), fullyDischarged(3), notPresent(4), nearEndOfLife(5), atEndOfLife(6), unknown(7), overCharged(8), fullyCharged(9).

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: NVRAM battery status is not OK

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Serial number
item_prototype.description: Node Serial Number. Same as productSerialNum for a specific node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Uptime
item_prototype.description: Node uptime. Same as sysUpTime for a specific node.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.cluster[nodeEnvFailedPowerSupplyCount, "{#NODE.NAME}"].last()}>0 and {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.cluster[nodeEnvFailedPowerSupplyMessage, "{#NODE.NAME}"].last()}={Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.cluster[nodeEnvFailedPowerSupplyMessage, "{#NODE.NAME}"].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Degraded power supplies count is more than zero

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.cluster[nodeEnvFailedFanCount, "{#NODE.NAME}"].last()}>0 and {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.cluster[nodeEnvFailedFanMessage, "{#NODE.NAME}"].last()}={Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.cluster[nodeEnvFailedFanMessage, "{#NODE.NAME}"].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Failed FAN count is over than zero

discovery_rule.name: CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of CPU metrics per node

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle.

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Total space available
item_prototype.description: The total disk space that is free for use on {#FSNAME}.

trigger_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Disk space is too low (below {$FAS3220.FS.AVAIL.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} for {$FAS3220.FS.TIME:"{#FSNAME}"})

item_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Total space
item_prototype.description: The total capacity in Bytes for {#FSNAME}.

item_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Total space used
item_prototype.description: The total disk space that is in use on {#FSNAME}.

item_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Saved by compression percents
item_prototype.description: Provides the percentage of compression savings in a volume, which is ((compr_saved/used)) * 10(compr_saved + 0). This is only returned for volumes.

item_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Saved by deduplication percents
item_prototype.description: Provides the percentage of deduplication savings in a volume, which is ((dedup_saved/(dedup_saved + used)) * 100). This is only returned for volumes.

item_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Used space percents
item_prototype.description: The percentage of disk space currently in use on {#FSNAME}.

trigger_prototype.name: {#VSERVER}{#FSNAME}: Disk space is too low (used over {$FAS3220.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}% for {$FAS3220.FS.TIME:"{#FSNAME}"})

discovery_rule.name: HA discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of high availability metrics per node

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Cannot takeover cause
item_prototype.description: The reason node cannot take over it's HA partner {#PARTNER.NAME}. Possible states: ok(1), unknownReason(2), disabledByOperator(3), interconnectOffline(4), disabledByPartner(5), takeoverFailed(6), mailboxIsInDegradedState(7), partnermailboxIsInUninitialisedState(8), mailboxVersionMismatch(9), nvramSizeMismatch(10), kernelVersionMismatch(11), partnerIsInBootingStage(12), diskshelfIsTooHot(13), partnerIsPerformingRevert(14), nodeIsPerformingRevert(15), sametimePartnerIsAlsoTryingToTakeUsOver(16), alreadyInTakenoverMode(17), nvramLogUnsynchronized(18), stateofBackupMailboxIsDoubtful(19).

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Node cannot takeover it's HA partner {#PARTNER.NAME}. Reason: {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: Possible reasons: unknownReason(2), disabledByOperator(3), interconnectOffline(4), disabledByPartner(5), takeoverFailed(6), mailboxIsInDegradedState(7), partnermailboxIsInUninitialisedState(8), mailboxVersionMismatch(9), nvramSizeMismatch(10), kernelVersionMismatch(11), partnerIsInBootingStage(12), diskshelfIsTooHot(13), partnerIsPerformingRevert(14), nodeIsPerformingRevert(15), sametimePartnerIsAlsoTryingToTakeUsOver(16), alreadyInTakenoverMode(17), nvramLogUnsynchronized(18), stateofBackupMailboxIsDoubtful(19).

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: HA settings
item_prototype.description: High Availability configuration settings. The value notConfigured(1) indicates that the HA is not licensed. The thisNodeDead(5) setting indicates that this node has been takenover.

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Node has been taken over
trigger_prototype.description: The thisNodeDead(5) setting indicates that this node has been takenover.

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE.NAME}: HA is not licensed
trigger_prototype.description: The value notConfigured(1) indicates that the HA is not licensed.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Health degraded reason
item_prototype.description: The list of reasons why the port is marked as degraded.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Health
item_prototype.description: The health status of the port.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): State
item_prototype.description: The link-state of the port. Normally it is either UP(2) or DOWN(3).

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Role
item_prototype.description: Role of the port. A port must have one of the following roles: cluster(1), data(2), mgmt(3), intercluster(4), cluster-mgmt(5) or undef(0). The cluster port is used to communicate to other node(s) in the cluster. The data port services clients' requests. It is where all the file requests come in. The management port is used by administrator to manage resources within a node. The intercluster port is used to communicate to other cluster. The cluster-mgmt port is used to manage resources within the cluster. The undef role is for the port that has not yet been assigned a role.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Speed
item_prototype.description: The speed appears on the port. It can be either undef(0), auto(1), ten Mb/s(2), hundred Mb/s(3), one Gb/s(4), or ten Gb/s(5).

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Up by an administrator
item_prototype.description: Indicates whether the port status is set 'UP' by an administrator.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.if[if64InErrors, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.if[if64OutErrors, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.if[if64InErrors, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.if[if64OutErrors, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.port[netportLinkState, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2 and {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.port[netportUpAdmin, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].last()}=1
trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description: Link state is not UP and the port status is set 'UP' by an administrator.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.port[netportHealthStatus, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>0 and {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.net.port[netportDegradedReason, "{#NODE}", "{#IFNAME}"].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: port {#IFNAME} ({#TYPE}): Port is not healthy

macro.description: The critical threshold of the CPU utilization in %.
Minimum available space on the disk. Can be used with {#FSNAME} as context.
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Maximum percentage of disk used. Can be used with {#FSNAME} as context.
The time during which disk usage may exceed the threshold. Can be used with {#FSNAME} as context.

This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level. Value should be integer: 2 - flexibleVolume, 3 - aggregate, 4 - stripedAggregate, 5 - stripedVolume.

This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level. Value should be integer: 2 - flexibleVolume, 3 - aggregate, 4 - stripedAggregate, 5 - stripedVolume.
Macro define what threshold will be used for disk space trigger: 0 - use Bytes ({$FAS3220.FS.AVAIL.MIN.CRIT}) 1 - use percents ({$FAS3220.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT}) Can be used with {#FSNAME} as context.
This macro is used in net ports discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
This macro is used in net ports discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.

This macro is used in net ports discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level. {#ROLE} is integer. Possible values: 0 - undef 1 - cluster 2 - data 3 - node-mgmt 4 - intercluster 5 - cluster-mgmt

This macro is used in net ports discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level. {#ROLE} is integer. Possible values: 0 - undef 1 - cluster 2 - data 3 - node-mgmt 4 - intercluster 5 - cluster-mgmt
This macro is used in net ports discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level. {#TYPE} is integer. Possible values: physical, if-group, vlan, undef.
This macro is used in net ports discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level. {#TYPE} is integer. Possible values: physical, if-group, vlan, undef.

trigger.expression: {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.disk[diskFailedCount].last()}>0 and {Template SAN NetApp FAS3220 SNMP:fas3220.disk[diskFailedMessage].diff()}=1
trigger.name: NetApp FAS3220: Number of failed disks has changed

mapping.newvalue: Partner mailbox is in uninitialised state
Same time partner is also trying to take us over
State of backup mailbox is doubtful
